description: Conservation biology focuses on the study of biological diversity. Students examine why
people should be concerned about the number and types of species on earth, what factors
threaten the survival of species, and how people can conserve them. Using principles of
ecology and evolution, with input from other disciplines, students gain a better
understanding of the impact of humans on biodiversity and the importance of responsible
environmental decision-making. Offered annually. Prerequisite: One natural science
